content.heading: Introduction
content.body: The **Delhi Police Recruitment 2025** has been announced by SSC, bringing new opportunities for aspirants aiming for a stable government job in law enforcement. The selection process is tough, but with the right strategy, candidates can succeed. This article explains the exam pattern, syllabus, physical standards, and preparation tips in detail.

content.heading: Exam Pattern Overview
content.body: The selection process includes four important stages. Below is a quick overview of the complete exam scheme:

content.heading: Computer Based Examination (CBE)
content.body: The **CBE** is the first and most important stage. It is of **90 minutes** duration, containing **100 questions** for **100 marks**. The exam is bilingual (**Hindi & English**) with **negative marking of 0.25** for each wrong answer.

content.heading: Syllabus Details
content.body:
The syllabus covers multiple areas:

- **General Awareness**: Current Affairs, Indian History, Constitution, Polity, Economy, Culture, Geography.
- **Quantitative Aptitude**: Percentages, Ratio, Profit & Loss, Algebra, Geometry, Trigonometry, Data Interpretation.
- **General Intelligence**: Coding-Decoding, Series, Puzzles, Decision Making, Venn Diagrams.
- **English**: Grammar, Comprehension, Synonyms, Antonyms, Idioms, Sentence Improvement.
- **Computer Fundamentals**: MS Word, MS Excel, PowerPoint, Email, Internet & Browsers.

content.heading: Physical Endurance Test (PET)

content.heading: Physical Measurement Test (PMT)
content.body: PMT checks **Height** and **Chest** (for males) and **Height** (for females). Relaxation is given for **SC/ST candidates** and residents of hill areas.

content.heading: Computer Formatting Test
content.body:
This is **qualifying only**, but candidates must demonstrate skills in **MS Word, MS PowerPoint, and MS Excel**. Key tasks include:

- Paragraph alignment, bullets, numbering, headers & footers.
- Creating slides with charts, images, hyperlinks.
- Excel functions, formulas, sorting, and formatting cells.

content.heading: Medical Standards
content.body: Candidates must be medically fit with **6/12 vision (with or without glasses)**. They should be free from deformities or diseases. PwBD candidates are allowed only under prescribed conditions.

content.heading: Preparation Tips
content.body:
Here are some important preparation strategies:

- **Academics**: Revise NCERTs for GK, practice mock tests for maths and reasoning.
- **Current Affairs**: Read newspapers daily and use monthly magazines.
- **Fitness**: Run daily, practice jumps, and build stamina.
- **Typing**: Practice 30 minutes daily on both Hindi and English.
- **Computer Skills**: Work on Word, Excel, and PowerPoint regularly.

Tip: Focus on weak areas early and maintain consistency.

content.heading: Conclusion
content.body: The **Delhi Police Recruitment 2025** is a golden opportunity for aspirants. With proper planning, regular fitness training, and focused study, candidates can crack the exam. content.heading: Introduction
content.body: The **DSSSB TGT (Trained Graduate Teacher) Recruitment 2025** has been officially announced. This recruitment provides a golden opportunity for aspirants to secure a government teaching position in Delhi schools. In this guide, we cover the exam pattern, complete syllabus, selection procedure, eligibility criteria, and preparation tips to help candidates succeed.

content.heading: Exam Pattern Overview
content.body: The DSSSB TGT exam is conducted in multiple stages. Here's a quick overview:

content.heading: Written Examination (Objective Type)
content.body: The written exam is the primary stage for selection. Duration is **2 hours**, consisting of **100-200 multiple-choice questions** depending on the subject. The exam is bilingual (**English & Hindi**) and carries **negative marking of 0.25 per wrong answer**.

content.heading: Detailed Syllabus
content.body:
The syllabus is divided into multiple sections to test knowledge and teaching ability:

- **General Awareness**: Current Affairs, Indian History, Constitution, Polity, Geography, Economy, and General Science.
- **English Language**: Grammar, Comprehension, Vocabulary, Synonyms, Antonyms, Sentence Correction.
- **Mathematics/Science**: Subject-specific topics based on TGT subject applied.
- **Teaching Methodology & Child Development**: Educational psychology, pedagogy, lesson planning, teaching strategies.
- **Computer Knowledge** (if applicable): MS Office basics, Internet usage, Computer Fundamentals.

content.heading: Selection Process
content.body: The DSSSB TGT selection process ensures candidates meet academic and teaching standards:

rows: Evaluates knowledge of the subject and general aptitude.
Assesses practical teaching skills, lesson delivery, and classroom management.
Verification of eligibility, qualifications, and personal documents.

content.heading: Eligibility Criteria
content.body: Candidates must meet the following conditions:

rows: Bachelor's Degree in relevant subject + B.Ed or equivalent.

content.heading: Preparation Tips
content.body:
Here are effective strategies for DSSSB TGT preparation:

- **Syllabus Coverage**: Study each topic thoroughly and follow the latest syllabus updates.
- **Mock Tests**: Practice previous years’ papers and online mock tests.
- **Current Affairs**: Read newspapers, magazines, and reliable online sources.
- **Time Management**: Create a timetable to balance teaching topics, general knowledge, and English.
- **Skill Practice**: For the teaching ability test, practice lesson delivery and interactive teaching techniques.

content.heading: Conclusion
content.body: The **DSSSB TGT 2025** recruitment is a remarkable opportunity for aspirants seeking a government teaching career. Proper planning, focused preparation, and regular practice of both theoretical and practical aspects will maximize chances of success.
